cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi E of Havana, Cuba and 115 mi S of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move north-northwest through the Straits of Florida, then turn north and ride up the west coast of Florida before curving north-northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Big Bend (north of Tampa)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas; west coast of Florida from Flamingo northward to Ochlockonee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys and entire west coast of Florida, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional squalls with gusts approaching tropical-storm force possible; sustained winds generally below gale force at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge impact expected on the Atlantic side of Florida including PortMiami.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1â€“3 inches of rain with brief urban ponding and reduced visibility.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible across south Florida tonight and Tuesday.
